# Creating the sticker

This is a short tutorial to easily create your own stickers!

Let's give it a try for this group and find our identity! ðŸ™ƒ

## 00. Libraries

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(magick)
library(hexSticker)
library(datasauRus)
#install.packages("datasauRus")
library(sysfonts)


```

## 01. Prepare images

```{r}
# datasauRus
datasaurus_df <- datasauRus::datasaurus_dozen %>% dplyr::filter(dataset == "dino")

dino_plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(datasaurus_df, aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_point(color = "#000000", size = 0.5) +
  theme_void()
```

## 02. Load fonts

```{r}

fonts <- font_files()

# Check font paths
font_paths()

# Add the font we want
font_add(family = "Courier New", 
         regular = "/System/Library/Fonts/Supplemental/Courier New.ttf")

```

## 03. Stickers

### Defining colors palette

```{r}
# define pallete
palette <- list('background' = '#FFC72A',
                'font' = '#C20430',
                'border' = '#000000',
                'note' = 'grey25')

# Single Palette elements
background_color = '#FFC72A'
font_color = "#C20430"
border_color = "#000000"
note_color = "grey25"

```

### Statasaurus logo

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false

statasaurus <- sticker(
  # Title
  package = "statasaurus",
  # Title attributes
  p_family = "Courier New",
  p_color = font_color,
  p_size = 16,
  p_y = 0.6,
  # Image
  subplot = dino_plot,
  # Image attributes
  s_width = 0.95,
  s_height = 0.95,
  s_x = 1,
  s_y = 1.2,
  # Hexagon attributes
  h_fill = background_color,
  h_color = border_color,
  h_size = 2,
  # Add a link
  url = "image: datasauRus package",
  u_size = 3,
  u_color = note_color,
  # Add spotlight
  spotlight = F,
  # Spotlight attributes
  # add some shadow to the pictures
  l_y = 1,
  l_width = 3,
  l_height = 3,
  l_alpha = 0.5,
  # File saving
  filename = "2024_logo.png",
  dpi = 300,
  white_around_sticker = FALSE
  ) 

```

::: panel-tabset
## Final logo

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| eval: true

statasaurus %>% print()

```
:::
